net.jenet

Class Peer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jenet.Peer

  • public class Peer
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a remote host. Elements of this class can not be created directly, a call to Host.connect should be used.

    Once connected, messages are sent to this peer using the send method.

    • Method Detail

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Requests a disconnection from this peer. When the disconnection is completed, Host.service will return an Event object having its type set to Event.TYPE.DISCONNECTED

      • disconnectNow

        public void disconnectNow()
        Immediately disconnects this peer. Performs instantaneous disconnection of this peer and sends it a disconnection notification which is not guaranteed to arrive. It will not produce an Event in Host.service.

      • getAddress

        public java.net.InetSocketAddress getAddress()
        Returns this peer's address.
        Returns:
        Returns the address.

      • getChannelCount

        public int getChannelCount()
        Returns the number of channels for this peer.
        Returns:
        number of channels.

      • getHost

        public Host getHost()
        Returns the host this peer is connected to.
        Returns:
        The host.

      • getIncomingBandwidth

        public int getIncomingBandwidth()
        Returns the actual incoming bandwidth used to communicate with this peer.
        Returns:
        The incomingBandwidth.

      • getLastRoundTripTime

        public int getLastRoundTripTime()
        Returns the last round trip time to communicate with this peer. The round trip time is the time elapsed between sending a reliable packet and the reception of the corresponding acknowledge.
        Returns:
        The time in milliseconds.

      • getPacketsLost

        public int getPacketsLost()
        The total number of packets lost when commincating with this peer.
        Returns:
        Returns the packetsLost.

      • getPacketsSent

        public int getPacketsSent()
        The total number of sent packets.
        Returns:
        Returns the packetsSent.

      • getRoundTripTime

        public int getRoundTripTime()
        Returns mean round trip time for reliable packages.
        Returns:
        the time in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        lastRoundTripTime

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if this peer is connected.
        Returns:
        the connection status

      • isConnecting

        public boolean isConnecting()
        Returns true if a connection request has been sent to this peer.
        Returns:
        the connection status

      • isDisconnected

        public boolean isDisconnected()
        Returns true if this peer has been disconnected. If the peer is disconnected, it will not get in its connected state again.
        Returns:
        the connection status

      • isDisconnecting

        public boolean isDisconnecting()
        Returns true if a disconnection request has been sent to this peer.
        Returns:
        the connection status

      • isZombie

        public boolean isZombie()
        Returns true if this peer is disconnecting due to a problem.
        Returns:
        the connection state

      • ping

        public void ping()
        Sends a ping to a a peer. This is automatically done by JeNet, so the only reason to call this method is to increase ping frequency.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Forcefully disconnects this peer. The foreign host represented by this peer is not notified of the disconnection and its connection with the local host will time out.

      • send

        public void send(byte channelID,
        Packet packet)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Queues a packet to be sent to this peer.
        Parameters:
        channelID - the channel on which to send
        packet - the packet to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on failure

      • throttleConfigure

        public void throttleConfigure(int interval,
                     int acceleration,
                     int deceleration)
        Parameters:
        interval - The time in milliseconds to calculate the mean RTT
        acceleration - The rate to increase the throttle as mean RTT increases
        deceleration - The rate to decrease the throttle as mean RTT decreases

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
